guide.introduction: The TurtleBot mobile robot is designed for both academic and hobbyist researchers. The open-source hardware design provides excellent documentation for adding modifications and extending the capabilities of the robot in hardware or software. The robot is available for purchase as a kit or, if your research budget is limited, this guide will help you turn your TurtleBot's Kinect into a pan-and-tilt head.
guide.introduction_rendered:
The TurtleBot mobile robot is designed for both academic and hobbyist researchers. The open-source hardware design provides excellent documentation for adding modifications and extending the capabilities of the robot in hardware or software. The robot is available for purchase as a kit or, if your research budget is limited, this guide will help you turn your TurtleBot's Kinect into a pan-and-tilt head.

Relevant parts
  • TurtleBot Head Base Plate
  • F3 Bioloid Bracket
  • F4 Bioloid Bracket
  • F10 Bioloid Bracket
  • Unthreaded Spacers Female
  • Machine screws, 4-40
  • Machine screws, 4-40
  • Custom Kinect mounting plate
  • Dynamixel AX-12A
  • 6-32x5/8" BHCS
  • Bioloid 180mm 3 Pin Cable
Tools
  • 5/32" drill bit
  • Screwdriver, small, Phillips
  • T10 Torx wrench

lines.text: The image on the left with the two red circles illustrates a case where the servo horn is not aligned with the mark on the servo body.
lines.text_raw: The image on the left with the two red circles illustrates a case where the servo horn is not aligned with the mark on the servo body.

lines.text: Rotate the servo horn with your fingers to bring the two marks into alignment.

lines.text: Insert the servo in the base in the only orientation it will fit.

lines.text: Turn the base around and put S2 screws into the corresponding 4 holes in the base plate, as shown on the right.
lines.text_raw: Turn the base around and put S2 screws into the corresponding 4 holes in the base plate, as shown on the right.

lines.text: Carefully create a shallow countersink for each of the 4 inner screw holes on the Kinect mounting plate using a 5/32 drill bit on VERY SLOW speed or a Dremel tool.
lines.text_raw: Carefully create a shallow countersink for each of the 4 inner screw holes on the Kinect mounting plate using a 5/32 drill bit on VERY SLOW speed or a Dremel tool.

lines.text: Be sure to make the countersink just deep enough so that the heads of the S4 bolts are flush with the plate's surface.  The picture on the right shows the desired result.
lines.text_raw: Be sure to make the countersink just deep enough so that the heads of the S4 bolts are flush with the plate's surface.  The picture on the right shows the desired result.

steps.title: Attach the Tilt Bracket to the Kinect Mounting Plate

lines.text: Slide the 4 S4 screws through the mounting plate, the F10 bracket and the top of the F4 bracket.
lines.text_raw: Slide the 4 S4 screws through the mounting plate, the F10 bracket and the top of the F4 bracket.

lines.text: Secure using 4 N1 nuts.  It is also recommended to use some blue thread locker on these connections since they will be difficult to access later if they loosen.
lines.text_raw: Secure using 4 N1 nuts.  It is also recommended to use some blue thread locker on these connections since they will be difficult to access later if they loosen.

lines.text: Pry off the protective grill on the bottom of the Kinect using a flat head screw driver.
lines.text_raw: Pry off the protective grill on the bottom of the Kinect using a flat head screw driver.

lines.text: Remove the 2 inner security screws (then ones nearest the swivel base) using the T10 Torx wrench (included in the Turtlebot kit).
lines.text_raw: Remove the 2 inner security screws (then ones nearest the swivel base) using the T10 Torx wrench (included in the Turtlebot kit).

lines.text: Use one of the security screws removed in the previous step to thread the 4 holes on the underside of the Kinect's base.
lines.text_raw: Use one of the security screws removed in the previous step to thread the 4 holes on the underside of the Kinect's base.

lines.text: Using a Phillips screw driver and the 4 1/2" 4-40 bolts, attach the mounting bracket and F4 bracket assembly to the base of the Kinect in the orientation shown in the photo.
lines.text_raw: Using a Phillips screw driver and the 4 1/2" 4-40 bolts, attach the mounting bracket and F4 bracket assembly to the base of the Kinect in the orientation shown in the photo.

lines.text: Tighten the 1/2" bolts until snug but DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN as this could strip the plastic threading.
lines.text_raw: Tighten the 1/2" bolts until snug but DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN as this could strip the plastic threading.

lines.text: Insert the 2" 4-40 bolts through the remaining 2 holes in the mounting plate, pass them through the spacers, and screw them into the holes where the security screws used to be.
lines.text_raw: Insert the 2" 4-40 bolts through the remaining 2 holes in the mounting plate, pass them through the spacers, and screw them into the holes where the security screws used to be.

lines.text: Tighten the 2 bolts until snug but DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN or you may strip the threads inside the security holes inside the Kinect.
lines.text_raw: Tighten the 2 bolts until snug but DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN or you may strip the threads inside the security holes inside the Kinect.

steps.title: Connect the Pan and Tilt Assemblies Together

lines.text: Install 4 N1 nuts on the bottom of the tilt servo.
lines.text_raw: Install 4 N1 nuts on the bottom of the tilt servo.

lines.text: Align the servo horn the same way you did for the pan servo.
lines.text_raw: Align the servo horn the same way you did for the pan servo.

lines.text: Connect the tilt servo to the F4 bracket.
lines.text_raw: Connect the tilt servo to the F4 bracket.

lines.text: Connect the base of the tilt servo to the F10 bracket on the pan servo.
lines.text_raw: Connect the base of the tilt servo to the F10 bracket on the pan servo.

steps.title: Cable the Servos and Add Standoffs

lines.text: Use a Bioloid 180 mm 3-pin cable to connect the 2 servos.
lines.text_raw: Use a Bioloid 180 mm 3-pin cable to connect the 2 servos.

lines.text: Attach 4 standoffs, at least 1.5" long, to the 4 holes on the pan servo platform.
lines.text_raw: Attach 4 standoffs, at least 1.5" long, to the 4 holes on the pan servo platform.

lines.text: The pan-and-tilt head is now ready to be mounted to your TurtleBot.
lines.text_raw: The pan-and-tilt head is now ready to be mounted to your TurtleBot.
